standards.description: Conduct an investigation to provide evidence that living things are made of cells
standards.subject: Life Science
standards.strand: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes
standards.full_text: Conduct an investigation to provide evidence that living things are made of cells; either one cell or many different numbers and types of cells.

standards.description: Develop and use a model to describe the function of a cell
standards.subject: Life Science
standards.strand: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes
standards.full_text: Develop and use a model to describe the function of a cell as a whole and ways parts of cells contribute to the function.

standards.description: Use argument supported by evidence for how the body is a system of interacting subsystems
standards.subject: Life Science
standards.strand: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes
standards.full_text: Use argument supported by evidence for how the body is a system of interacting subsystems composed of groups of cells.

standards.description: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for how environmental and genetic factors influence the growth of organisms
standards.subject: Life Science
standards.strand: From Molecules to Organisms: Structures and Processes
standards.full_text: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for how environmental and genetic factors influence the growth of organisms.

standards.description: Analyze and interpret data to provide evidence for the effects of resource availability on organisms and populations
standards.subject: Life Science
standards.full_text: Analyze and interpret data to provide evidence for the effects of resource availability on organisms and populations of organisms in an ecosystem.

standards.description: Construct an explanation that predicts patterns of interactions among organisms
standards.subject: Life Science
standards.full_text: Construct an explanation that predicts patterns of interactions among organisms across multiple ecosystems.

standards.description: Develop and use a model to describe why structural changes to genes may affect proteins
standards.subject: Life Science
standards.strand: Heredity: Inheritance and Variation of Traits
standards.full_text: Develop and use a model to describe why structural changes to genes (mutations) located on chromosomes may affect proteins and may result in harmful, beneficial, or neutral effects to the structure and function of the organism.

standards.description: Analyze and interpret data for patterns in the fossil record
standards.subject: Life Science
standards.full_text: Analyze and interpret data for patterns in the fossil record that document the existence, diversity, extinction, and change of life forms throughout the history of life on Earth.

standards.description: Develop models to describe the atomic composition of simple molecules and extended structures
standards.subject: Physical Science
standards.full_text: Develop models to describe the atomic composition of simple molecules and extended structures.

standards.description: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after an interaction
standards.subject: Physical Science
standards.full_text: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact to determine if a chemical reaction has occurred.

standards.description: Develop a model that predicts and describes changes in particle motion, temperature, and state
standards.subject: Physical Science
standards.full_text: Develop a model that predicts and describes changes in particle motion, temperature, and state of a pure substance when thermal energy is added or removed.

standards.description: Apply Newton's Third Law to design a solution to a problem involving the motion of two colliding objects
standards.subject: Physical Science
standards.strand: Motion and Stability: Forces and Interactions
standards.full_text: Apply Newton's Third Law to design a solution to a problem involving the motion of two colliding objects.

standards.description: Plan an investigation to provide evidence that the change in an object's motion depends on the sum of the forces acting on the object
standards.subject: Physical Science
standards.strand: Motion and Stability: Forces and Interactions
standards.full_text: Plan an investigation to provide evidence that the change in an object's motion depends on the sum of the forces acting on the object and the mass of the object.

standards.description: Construct and interpret graphical displays of data to describe the relationships of kinetic energy
standards.subject: Physical Science
standards.full_text: Construct and interpret graphical displays of data to describe the relationships of kinetic energy to the mass of an object and to the speed of an object.

standards.description: Apply scientific principles to design, construct, and test a device that minimizes or maximizes thermal energy transfer
standards.subject: Physical Science
standards.full_text: Apply scientific principles to design, construct, and test a device that either minimizes or maximizes thermal energy transfer.

standards.description: Use mathematical representations to describe a simple model for waves
standards.subject: Physical Science
standards.full_text: Use mathematical representations to describe a simple model for waves that includes how the amplitude of a wave is related to the energy in a wave.

standards.description: Develop and use a model of the Earth-sun-moon system to describe cyclic patterns
standards.subject: Earth and Space Science
standards.full_text: Develop and use a model of the Earth-sun-moon system to describe the cyclic patterns of lunar phases, eclipses of the sun and moon, and seasons.

standards.description: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence from rock strata for how the geologic time scale is used to organize Earth's history
standards.subject: Earth and Space Science
standards.full_text: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence from rock strata for how the geologic time scale is used to organize Earth's 4.6-billion-year-old history.

standards.description: Develop a model to describe the cycling of Earth's materials and the flow of energy
standards.subject: Earth and Space Science
standards.full_text: Develop a model to describe the cycling of Earth's materials and the flow of energy that drives this process.

standards.description: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how geoscience processes have changed Earth's surface
standards.subject: Earth and Space Science
standards.full_text: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how geoscience processes have changed Earth's surface at varying time and spatial scales.

standards.description: Develop a model to describe the cycling of water through Earth's systems driven by energy from the sun
standards.subject: Earth and Space Science
standards.full_text: Develop a model to describe the cycling of water through Earth's systems driven by energy from the sun and the force of gravity.

standards.description: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for how the uneven distributions of Earth's mineral, energy, and groundwater resources are the result of past and current geoscience processes
standards.subject: Earth and Space Science
standards.full_text: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for how the uneven distributions of Earth's mineral, energy, and groundwater resources are the result of past and current geoscience processes.

standards.description: Apply scientific principles to design a method for monitoring and minimizing a human impact on the environment
standards.subject: Earth and Space Science
standards.full_text: Apply scientific principles to design a method for monitoring and minimizing a human impact on the environment.

standards.description: Ask questions to clarify evidence of the factors that have caused the rise in global temperatures over the past century
standards.subject: Earth and Space Science
standards.full_text: Ask questions to clarify evidence of the factors that have caused the rise in global temperatures over the past century.

standards.description: Define the criteria and constraints of a design problem
standards.subject: Engineering
standards.full_text: Define the criteria and constraints of a design problem with sufficient precision to ensure a successful solution, taking into account relevant scientific principles and potential impacts on people and the natural environment.
